questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: Mariah asked “Do you want milk and sugar in your coffee?”
Mariah asked, “Do you want milk and sugar in your coffee?”
Mariah asked, Do you want cream and sugar in your coffee?”

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Your group presentations are tomorrow,” Ms. Hines said.
“Your group presentations are tomorrow” Ms. Hines said.
“Your group presentations are tomorrow”, Ms. Hines said.

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Watch out,” Raquel shouted “The floor is wet over there!”
“Watch out!” Raquel shouted, “The floor is wet over there!”
“Watch out!” Raquel shouted. “The floor is wet over there!”

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Have you ever been to the zoo"? Skyler asked.
“Have you ever been to the zoo” Skyler asked.
“Have you ever been to the zoo?” Skyler asked.

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Be sure to stretch before practice,” Coach Santos said.
“Be sure to stretch before practice” Coach Santos said.
“Be sure to stretch before practice, Coach Santos said.

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Do you have time,” Alexis asked, “to pack up these boxes?”
“Do you have time” Alexis asked, “to pack up these boxes?”
“Do you have time,” Alexis asked. “to pack up these boxes?”

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: Peyton exclaimed, “I accidentally burned the brownies!”
Peyton exclaimed “I accidentally burned the brownies!”
Peyton exclaimed, I accidentally burned the brownies!”

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “Tomorrow,” said Principal Boyle, “is the big pep rally.”
“Tomorrow,” said Principal Boyle, is the big pep rally.
“Tomorrow” said Principal Boyle “is the big pep rally.”

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: “I can’t believe you’re here! my excited sister shouted.
“I can’t believe you’re here!,” my excited sister shouted.
“I can’t believe you’re here!” my excited sister shouted.

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation and quotation marks correctly?

choices.answer: Doug said, I have to study for my Algebra test tomorrow.
Doug said, “I have to study for my Algebra test tomorrow."
Doug said “I have to study for my Algebra test tomorrow."
